question: Which test is used to diagnose colour synesthesia?
ideal_answer: A standardized test battery for the study of synesthesia. We used synesthetic versions of the Stroop test with colored letters and numbers presented either in the right or the left visual field of thirty-four synesthetes. Assessment of the hemispheric lateralization of grapheme-color synesthesia with Stroop-type tests.

snippets.text: To remedy this deficit we have devised the Synesthesia Battery. This unified collection of tests is freely accessible online (http://www.synesthete.org). It consists of a questionnaire and several online software programs, and test results are immediately available for use by synesthetes and invited researchers.
A standardized test battery for the study of synesthesia.
The application and results of consistency, psychophysical, and Stroop tests are presented later.

This study aims to find the most reliable way of diagnosing grapheme-colour synaesthesia based on maximising sensitivity (i.e., ability of a test to identify true synaesthetes) and specificity (i.e., ability of a test to identify true non-synaesthetes).
Assessment of the hemispheric lateralization of grapheme-color synesthesia with Stroop-type tests
We used synesthetic versions of the Stroop test with colored letters and numbers presented either in the right or the left visual field of thirty-four synesthetes.
